post: The Bill of Rights Institute is committed to ensuring teachers and students have the resources and support they need as they head back to the classroom this school year. Here's what one teacher from Texas has to say about our resources: "Thank you for supporting teachers in our quest to make history come alive in our classroom. I am so grateful not only to have been introduced to the Bill of Rights Institute but to have so many resources to take back to use... Because of your assistance, many teachers will be returning school with ideas and resources that will inspire their students. Thank you!" To see how you can help us support teachers and students, visit  https://lnkd.in/ePsJtSJy  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #civicseducation

Make a difference today by supporting Power of the Printed Word! The Power of the Printed Word is a funding and printing initiative to enable BRI to provide pocket copies of the U. S. Constitution to teachers and students nationwide. Our pocket constitutions are valuable teaching tools that give students access to primary sources, including the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights. Our pocket constitutions are in high demand among history, government and civics teachers. Learn more at  https://lnkd.in/eeKJPSd5  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

Do you have a will? Despite the importance of having a will (or trust), many Americans never get around to drafting one. Or their will was drawn up many years ago and has not been looked at since. Now may be the right time to review or create your will, during Make-a-Will Month. A well-thought-out will plan helps minimize conflicts, maximizes a positive impact on family and others, and can give you peace of mind. If you would like to learn more about getting started on creating your will or updating your current estate plans, we would be happy to make available to you our easy-to-follow Estate Planning Guide. Just visit  https://lnkd.in/ehPuv2vW  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MakeaWillMonth

The Bill of Rights Insitute is proud to be supported by Liberty Tutors. Liberty Tutors offers a wide range of Social Studies tutoring and enrichment classes that cater to diverse needs and interests. Here's what founder and teacher Donna Vitek says about BRI: "As a teacher, I have found the Bill of Rights Institute to be an invaluable resource when teaching Civics, US History, and Constitutional Law. I have found the primary source documents that provide annotations to be very useful for students with learning disabilities. It equalizes the playing field within a classroom for interpreting the information contained in primary source documents. I have seen, first-hand, the confidence in my students abilities increase drastically due to their ability to debate with their peers. Thank you, Bill of Rights Institute!" To learn more about Liberty Tutors, visit  https://libertytutors.net/  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #testimonial

A former Bill of Rights Institutes National Teacher Council member was recently recognized by a national organization for her work with students. Jessica Culver, who teaches history at Ozark High School in Ozark, Ark., was named that states History Teacher of the Year by the Gilder Lehman Institute of American History. According to its website, teachers in each state are nominated by students, parents, other teachers, and community members. A committee of history teachers, professors, and other education professionals reviews the nominees from each state and selects the winners. Culver said she was incredibly honored  to receive the award and added she is in the company of some amazing educators from all across our country's states and territories, and it is truly meaningful to be recognized alongside so many wonderful educators.  Read more here  https://lnkd.in/ekB4YxFy

How can the Constitution help unify Americans? In this episode of Scholar Talks, Yuval Levin, Director of Social, Cultural, and Constitutional Studies at the American Enterprise Institute, joins BRI Senior Fellow Tony Williams to discuss his new book, American Covenant: How the Constitution Unified Our NationAnd Could Again. This episode explores how the Constitution can help unify Americans, the roles of federalism and localism, the importance of Congress, the contributions of the president and Supreme Court, and how stronger political parties and elections can promote unity. Watch here  https://lnkd.in/emKvntpb  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #ScholarTalks

Thank you so much to the Bill of Rights Institute for this incredible opportunity to share my work with The World in Us! The MyImpact Challenge has been an invaluable supporter for the continued development of my civic leadership journey at The World in Us and beyond. By providing $10,000 in funding, a powerful network of youth changemakers, and a framework for connecting individual service with the founding principles of our nation, the Bill of Rights Institute has deepened both the personal and community-wide impact of my work.

post: We had the opportunity to catch up with Caroline Gao, the Grand Prize winner of BRI's 2023 MyImpact Challenge civic engagement contest. Listen to Caroline describe her nonprofit, The World in Us, a youth-to-youth cultural education organization, and the ways in which MyImpact Challenge helped her to connect concepts like citizenship skills and civic virtues to her work. These are foundational skills and ways of thinking that I dont think I would have internalized nearly as much as I have now if not for the MyImpact Challenge,  Gao said.  https://lnkd.in/ebyqpN3X.
